isis.stitle: CAB: DAYCAB AND SLEEPER CAB for ProStar, ProStar Premium, and ProStar Limited Models - REMOVE - CAB DOOR LOCK CYLINDER

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Door Lock Cylinder on Daycab and Sleeper Cab
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 50 for Items in parentheses.
The cab door lock cylinder (Item 7) on cab doors are key coded the same as the ignition switch on instrument panel, so that one key operates both the ignition switch and door locks.

step1.para: Using a flat blade screw driver (Item 1), covered with a cloth rag to protect the painted surface of cab door (Item 2), carefully slide screw driver blade between cab door and outer cab door handle trim bezel (Item 3) and carefully pry outer cab door handle trim bezel away from cab door, driver side shown.

note.para: The plastic tabs that hold the outer cab door handle trim bezel (Item 3) will likely break off during removal. A new outer cab door handle trim bezel will likely be needed if service to the cab door requires removing it.

step1.para: Using a flat blade screw driver (Item 4) remove retaining clip (Item 5) from behind outer door handle (Item 6) and remove cab door lock cylinder (Item 7) from the cavity in outer door handle, driver side shown.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side cab door lock cylinder from cab door.
